Title: How do I request treatment for a new health concern?
Description:
Before requesting treatment, you may need a GP referral.

[Check if you need a GP referral](app://faqDetails/028140FBE19D45EF9591E64A30ECE6FE)

### Already got a referral? ###
Follow these steps to request treatment.

1. Choose ‘Pre-authorisations’ on your My Bupa home screen. 
2. Where it says ‘Do I need a pre-auth’, there’s the option to request treatment.
3. Complete the request form and we'll email you within 24 hours. You'll get a pre-authorisation number or we'll explain why you're not covered.

Title: Do I need to speak to a GP before getting treatment?
Description:
Not always.

### Some health concerns don’t need a GP referral. ###

If your concern is listed, select it to see next steps.
Footer:
### Any other health concerns ###
You'll need to speak to a GP about your symptoms so they can decide what type of specialist or tests you need next.

Title: Next steps for cancer worries
Description:
### If you’re 18 or over ###
Please call us on [0800 012 1305](phone://08000121305).

We’ll talk through your symptoms and advise you on next steps.

We’re available Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 4pm. We may record or monitor our phone calls.

### If you need help for a child ### 
Please book a digital GP appointment. They’ll be able to talk through any worries and refer your child to a cancer specialist if needed.

Title: Next steps for muscles, bones and joints
Description:
Please call us on [0345 600 8277](phone://03456008277).

We’ll talk through your symptoms and advise you on next steps, such as a phone or video call with a physio.

We’re available Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 4pm. We may record or monitor our phone calls.

Title: Next steps for mental health
Description:
Please call us on [0345 600 5446](phone://03456005446).

We’ll listen to how you’re feeling and advise you on next steps, such as a phone consultation with a mental health specialist.

We’re available Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 4pm. We may record or monitor our phone calls.

Title: Next steps for moles or skin lesions
Description:
Please call us on [0345 600 4534](phone://03456004534).

We’ll talk through your symptoms and advise you on next steps 

If you're over 18, we may suggest a remote skin assessment. This includes sending a kit to your home to check your moles and for skin cancer. 

We’re available Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 4pm. We may record or monitor our phone calls.

Title: How do I request more treatment?
Description:
You’ll need to get a new pre-authorisation code.

This is so we can check how much more you’re covered for.

### Follow these steps: ###
1. Choose ‘Pre-authorisations’ on your My Bupa home screen. 
2. Where it says ‘Do I need a pre-auth’, there’s the option to request treatment.
3. Complete the request form and we'll email you within 24 hours. You'll get a pre-authorisation number or we'll explain why you're not covered.

Title: Can I book an ADHD or autism assessment?
Description:
You’ll need to check your guide to see if you’re covered first.

1. Go to your My Bupa home screen and scroll down. Next, choose ‘Documents’. 
2. From here, you can view or download your guide which includes a benefit table. 
3. Look for ‘assessments of neurological conditions’ in the table, which covers ADHD and autism.
4. If you’re covered, please book a GP appointment to get a referral for an assessment with a specialist.

Title: Can I book a general health check?
Description:
If you’d like to book a health check, these are bought separately.  

We call our checks health assessments. The easiest way to compare options and book, is on [our website](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-assessments). 

### Get Bupa cover with work? ###
Your employer may have bought a health assessment for you. Please ask them for more details.

Title: What does pre-authorisation mean?
Description:
When we say pre-authorisation, we mean approval to go ahead with certain tests, consultations or treatment. For example, blood tests, physio, counselling and surgery. 
 
When these happen without pre-authorisation, you may need to pay the full cost. 

### You don’t need a pre-auth for: ###
- Digital GP appointments
- Prescribed medication
- Fit notes

Title: Do I need a pre-authorisation number before treatment?
Description:
### You don’t need one for: ###
- Digital GP appointments
- Prescribed medication
- Fit notes

### What you need one for: ###
Everything else, from blood tests to physio, counselling to surgery.

If you go ahead without pre-authorisation, you may need to pay the full cost.

Title: How do I get a pre-authorisation number?
Description:
### If you have a referral ###
From your home screen, choose ‘Pre-authorisations’. There will be a button for you to request treatment, where you can start to get a pre-authorisation. 

Once you’ve completed the request form, you’ll hear back from us by email within 24 hours.

### If you don’t have a referral ###
How to get a pre-authorisation number depends on your symptoms.

If your health concern is listed below, select it to see next steps.
Footer:
### Any other health concerns ###
You’ll need a GP referral before we can pre-authorise treatment. This is to make sure we’re approving the most suitable care.

Title: How do I pre-authorise more treatment?
Description:
You’ll need to get a new pre-authorisation number for your next stage of treatment. 

For example, if you need surgery following an appointment with a consultant. Or, if you’ve been for physio sessions and they recommend more. You would need a new pre-authorisation number before going ahead.

### To request a new pre-authorisation number: ###
1. Choose ‘Pre-authorisations’ on your My Bupa home screen. 
2. Where it says ‘Do I need a pre-auth’, there’s the option to request treatment.
3. Complete the request form and we'll email you within 24 hours. You'll get a pre-authorisation number or we'll explain why you're not covered.

Title: Where can I find my pre-authorisation number?
Description:
We'll email your pre-authorisation number to you and add it your My Bupa app. If you turn on push notifications for the app, we’ll also let you know when it’s ready.

From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Pre-authorisations’.

Next, choose ‘View pre-authorisations’, then scroll to select the one you need.

### If your number isn’t there ###
- It can take up to one working day to appear.
- If we're reviewing a request or something isn't covered, this won't show in the app. We'll always contact you if something isn't covered to explain why.

Title: When will I get my pre-authorisation number?
Description:
### If you’ve had a Bupa GP appointment ###
Most often, our team take a few hours to review each treatment request. Sometimes, it can take up to one working day. 

For example, we get your request at 2pm on Monday and we review it by 2pm on Tuesday.

If you’ve not had a number after one working day, [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll look into it for you.

### Not spoken to a Bupa GP? ###
Please [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) instead.

Title: What does my pre-authorisation cover?
Description:
Each pre-authorisation is different. We'll always confirm what it covers and who you can see.

To view these, go to ‘Pre-authorisations’ from your My Bupa home screen. 

Choose ‘View pre-authorisations’, then scroll to select the one you’d like details for. 

Sometimes, you may see the phrase ‘minor diagnostic tests’. These are fairly quick tests such as X-rays, blood tests and ultrasounds.

Title: What do minor diagnostics tests include and exclude?
Description:
Minor diagnostic tests are tests to help your consultant understand acute symptoms.

Acute symptoms are those likely to respond to treatment quickly. 

### Examples of minor diagnostics: ###
- X-rays
- blood tests
- ultrasounds 

### What isn’t a minor diagnostic? ###
- Scans such as an MRI or a CT scan
- Admission to hospital or an overnight stay
- Any type of procedure, from simple injections to surgery
- A referral to see a different consultant or therapist

[View the full list](https://www.bupa.co.uk/~/media/Files/MMS/MMS-hosting/bins-06499) of what is and isn’t included online.

Title: How long is my pre-authorisation number valid?
Description:
Your number is valid for nine months.
 
If your symptoms have changed since you got pre-authorisation, we suggest getting a new number. This is because we may suggest different treatment or tests to investigate your current symptoms.

Title: Do I need a GP referral?
Description:
Not always.

### Some health concerns don’t need a GP referral. ###

If your concern is listed, select it to see next steps.
Footer:
### Any other health concerns ###
You'll need to speak to a GP about your symptoms so they can decide what type of specialist or tests you need next.

### Already for got a referral but not from a GP? ###
That’s okay, we accept lots of different referrals. We list all the ones we accept online.

[Check your type of referral](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-insurance/medical-referrals)

Title: What information do I need if I get an NHS GP referral?
Description:
Please ask for an open referral letter. 

This means the GP will decide what type of care or treatment they recommend, but it won’t specify who with or where. The referral is open. 

### Why this is important ###
- We need to check you’re covered before you see someone.
- We can give you a choice of people or places that are Bupa recognised. This means they meet our standards of customer experience and care. Plus, their fees are taken care of by your cover.

Title: Where can I find my referral?
Description:
We'll send you an email when it's ready. This can take up to six hours.

Your email will include a link to a portal where you’ll verify your phone number using a code we text to your phone.

Once you’re verified, you’ll be able to download your referral letter.

### Not arrived within six hours? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through your work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll get started.

Title: What do I do with my GP referral?
Description:
Once you have a referral, you’ll need a pre-authorisation number. This is to make sure you’re covered for what’s being recommended.

For next steps, please choose who you got your referral from.
Footer:
### Not sure who you got it from? ###
If you had a Bupa digital appointment, you can check your appointment history. 

From your home screen, go to ‘Treatment and care’ and then ‘Manage appointments. You can view past appointments here. 

If you had any other appointment type, please [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).

Title: Referrals from a Bupa digital GP
Description:
You don’t need to do anything. 

One of our team will review your referral and check you’re covered. 

We’ll email you within one working day with a pre-authorisation number or to explain why you’re not covered. Sometimes, we may ask for more information before making a decision.

Title: Referrals from a Bupa mental health nurse
Description:
You need to tell us about your referral. 

This is so we can check your cover and create a pre-authorisation. 

The easiest way to request a consultation, tests or treatment is in My Bupa. From your home screen, choose ‘Pre-authorisations’. There will be a button for you to request treatment, which starts the process of getting a pre-authorisation. 

Once you’ve completed the request form, we'll email you within one working day. We may send a pre-authorisation number, ask for more information or explain why you’re not covered.

Title: Referrals from a Bupa advanced nurse practioner
Description:
You don’t need to do anything. 

One of our team will review your referral and check you’re covered. 

We’ll email you within one working day with a pre-authorisation number or to explain why you’re not covered. Sometimes, we may ask for more information before making a decision.

Title: Referrals from a physiotherapist
Description:
### If you spoke to a physio by booking a digital appointment ###

You don’t need to do anything. 

One of our team will review your referral and check you’re covered. 

We’ll email you within one working day with a pre-authorisation number or to explain why you’re not covered. Sometimes we may ask for more information before making a decision.

### If we booked you in with an advanced physio practitioner ###

You need to tell us about your referral. 

This is so we can check your cover and create a pre-authorisation. 

The easiest way to request a consultation, tests or treatment is in My Bupa. From your home screen, choose ‘Pre-authorisations’. There will be a button for you to request treatment, which starts the process of getting a pre-authorisation. 

Once you’ve completed the request form, we'll email you within one working day. We may send a pre-authorisation number, ask for more information or explain why you’re not covered.

Title: Referrals from a Bupa health assessment
Description:
You need to tell us about your referral. 

This is so we can check your cover and create a pre-authorisation. 

The easiest way to request a consultation, tests or treatment is in My Bupa. From your home screen, choose ‘Pre-authorisations’. There will be a button for you to request treatment, which starts the process of getting a pre-authorisation. 

Once you’ve completed the request form, we'll email you within one working day. We may send a pre-authorisation number, ask for more information or explain why you’re not covered.

Title: Referrals from the NHS
Description:
You need to tell us about your referral. 

This is so we can check your cover and create a pre-authorisation. 

The easiest way to request a consultation, tests or treatment is in My Bupa. From your home screen, choose ‘Pre-authorisations’. There will be a button for you to request treatment, which starts the process of getting a pre-authorisation. 

Once you’ve completed the request form, we'll email you within one working day. We may send a pre-authorisation number, ask for more information or explain why you’re not covered.

Title: Referrals from other professionals
Description:
We accept a range of referrals, but it’s best to check we accept the one you have first.

[Check your type of referral](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-insurance/medical-referrals)

If we accept your type of referral, your next step is to get a pre-authorisation number.

From your home screen, choose ‘Pre-authorisations’. There will be a button for you to request treatment, which starts the process of getting a pre-authorisation. 

Once you’ve completed the request form, we'll email you within one working day. We may send a pre-authorisation number, ask for more information or explain why you’re not covered.

Title: When will I get my GP referral?
Description:
It can take up to six hours, but it’s often sooner.

### Not arrived within six hours? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through your work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
 3. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll look into where your referral is.

Title: How can I get a referral to see a specialist?
Description:
Sometimes you’ll need a GP referral, but for some health concerns you can skip that part. It all depends on your symptoms. 

If your health concern is listed, select it to see next steps.
Footer:
### Any other health concerns ###
You’ll need to speak to a GP first so they can discuss your symptoms and decide what type of tests or specialist you need to see.

Title: Can I use a referral that’s not from a GP?
Description:
We accept lots of different referrals, so it doesn’t always need to be from a GP. 

Check the [full list of referrals](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-insurance/medical-referrals) we accept online.

Title: Do I need to pay for consultations?
Description:
Sometimes. It depends on your type of cover and if you have a benefit allowance, excess or co-pay.

### If you have a benefit allowance ###
This is how much you’re covered for in a year for different types of consultations or treatment.

### If you have any excess left ###
You’ll need to pay this towards your consultation cost. We’ll pay the rest up to your benefit allowance.

### If you have no excess ###
We’ll cover the full cost of your consultation up to your benefit allowance.

### If your cover renewal date is coming up ###
When renewing, your excess resets. This happens on the same date you got your cover. 

If your consultation takes place after renewal, you’ll be asked to pay your excess again. This may cover all or some of the costs of your consultation. If it only covers part, we’ll pay the rest up to your benefit allowance.

### If you have a co-pay ###
This is when you pay a percentage of your treatment cost, up to a total amount each year. We’ll pay the rest up to your benefit allowance.

### Important information ###
Checking your documents can help you understand your cover more. 

For example, if your cover includes a set number of consultations within six months, we’ll tell you. 

To find your documents, go to your My Bupa home screen and scroll down. Next, choose ‘Documents’.

Title: How can I find an authorised consultant?
Description:
We’ll give you a choice of  consultants, so you don’t need to search. 

### Where to see your options ###
- Your pre-authorisation email
- My Bupa. Go to ‘Pre-authorisations’ and choose the relevant one.

If you already have a consultant in mind or you’d like to look at all consultants, you can use our [finder search tool](https://www.finder.bupa.co.uk/).

Once you’ve checked their profile, you’ll need to speak to us to get a pre-authorisation number. 

If you book an appointment with them before getting a code, you may not be covered. This means you would need to pay for the appointment yourself.

Title: How do I choose a consultant?
Description:
When you get a pre-authorisation number, we’ll include the names of some specialists. You’re approved to see any of them. 

Select each name to view their profile. This will tell you more about them and explain how to book an appointment.

### Where to see your options ###
- Your pre-authorisation email
- My Bupa. Go to ‘Pre-authorisations’ and choose the relevant one.

Title: What should I do if I can't get a consultant appointment?
Description:
If all the consultants we offered you have busy calendars, we can send you more options. 

To request more options, please [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).

Title: How do I book a digital GP appointment?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, you’ll see an option for ‘Treatment and care’. 

Next, you can ‘Book a digital appointment’. 

### If it’s for you ###
First we’ll ask about your symptoms. This is so we can recommend an appointment with either a GP, nurse, physio or mental health specialist. Then you can choose an appointment time. 

### If it’s for a child ###
For children under 16, only the main member or beneficiary on your cover can book for them. 

Children aged 16 or over will need to create their own account to book.

Title: Can I choose the gender of the person I speak to?
Description:
When booking your digital appointment, we’ll ask you if you have a preference. 

You can then choose male or female and we’ll only show you available appointments that match your preference.

Title: Will I always speak to a GP when booking a digital appointment?
Description:
Not always. That's because we want to guide you to the most appropriate source of support as quickly as possible.

Depending on your symptoms, we can direct you to a GP, advanced nurse practitioner, physio or mental health specialist.

Title: Can I book a digital appointment for an emergency?
Description:
Please call 999 for urgent medical needs rather than booking an appointment. 

### Urgent medical needs ###
- Chest pain
- Severe bleeding
- Severe difficulty breathing (shortness of breath)
- Sudden, severe pain 
- Moderate or severe burns
- Convulsions or seizures
- A sudden change in mental status (such as unusual behaviour, confusion or difficulty waking from sleep)
- If you have harmed yourself or have plans to end your life
- Head or spinal injuries
- Broken bones

Title: How do I change or cancel my digital appointment?
Description:
In the My Bupa app, go to ‘Treatment’ in the bottom menu. 

From here, you can manage your appointments.

Choose the appointment you’d like to cancel, then if you’d like a new time, you just need to book a new appointment.

Title: How do I join my digital appointment?
Description:
Go to your My Bupa home screen five minutes before your appointment to join.

Once you’ve joined, the GP or healthcare professional can join too. 

### Audio calls ###
We’ll ask you to verify your address. 

### Video calls ###
When booking your appointment, you get the option to verify your ID.

If you chose to skip, we’ll need to verify your ID when you join your first video call. You’ll need either your passport, driver’s license or residence permit. 

We won’t ask for it again before any future video calls.

Title: How does a private prescription work?
Description:
After you’ve had a Bupa digital GP appointment, we’ll email you with a prescription ID the same or next working day.

We work with a company called SignatureRX who will use this ID to let pharmacies know what medication you need.

The email will give you two choices, collection or delivery.

### If you choose collection ###
Your email includes a pharmacy locator. Not every pharmacy accepts SignatureRX prescriptions, so please check the list first.

### If you choose delivery ###
You’ll get a second email with a payment link, usually within two hours.

Once paid, your medication will usually be delivered within 48 hours. If you live in London, you can get same day delivery if your request is before 4pm, Monday to Friday, or before 12pm on weekends.

Title: Do I need to pay for a private prescription?
Description:
You will need to pay for the medication listed on your prescription.

Medication costs vary by medicine and by the pharmacy who dispenses it, it’s not a flat fee like in the NHS

### If you want to collect your prescription ###
The pharmacy will tell you the cost.

### If you want your prescription delivered ###
The cost of your medication and delivery will be shown before you pay.

Title: Where can I find my prescription?
Description:
We’ll send you an email when it’s ready. This can take up to one working day.

### Not arrived within one working day? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll get started.

Title: Where can I find my fit note?
Description:
We’ll send you an email when it’s ready. This can take up to one working day.

Your email will include a link to a portal where you’ll be asked to verify your phone number. To do this, you’ll be sent a code by SMS to your phone.

Once you’re verified, you’ll be able to download your fit note.

### Not arrived within one working day? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll get started.

Description:
Not always.

### Some health concerns don’t need a GP referral. ###

If your concern is listed, select it to see next steps.
Footer:
### Any other health concerns ###
You'll need to speak to a GP about your symptoms so they can decide what type of specialist or tests you need next.

Once you have a referral, you’ll need a pre-authorisation number. This is to make sure you’re covered for what’s being recommended.

For next steps, please choose who you got your referral from.
Footer:
### Not sure who you got it from? ###
If you had a Bupa digital appointment, you can check your appointment history. 

From your home screen, go to ‘Treatment and care’ and then ‘Manage appointments. You can view past appointments here. 

If you had any other appointment type, please [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).

Title: When will I get my GP referral?
Description:
It can take up to six hours, but it’s often sooner.

### Not arrived within six hours? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through your work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
 3. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll look into where your referral is.

Title: How can I get a referral to see a specialist?
Description:
Sometimes you’ll need a GP referral, but for some health concerns you can skip that part. It all depends on your symptoms. 

If your health concern is listed, select it to see next steps.
Footer:
### Any other health concerns ###
You’ll need to speak to a GP first so they can discuss your symptoms and decide what type of tests or specialist you need to see.

Title: Can I use a referral that’s not from a GP?
Description:
We accept lots of different referrals, so it doesn’t always need to be from a GP. 

Check the [full list of referrals](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-insurance/medical-referrals) we accept online.

Title: What is a claim?
Description:
A claim is something we set up for you once we've received a bill for any pre-authorised  treatment you’ve had.

We'll pay the bill and let you know if there's anything you need to pay.

Title: How do I make a claim?
Description:
So you can focus on getting help for your health, we don’t ask you to set up a claim. 

You’ll book your appointments and we’ll take care of processing your claim once you’ve had treatment.

### How it works ###
1. Book your first appointment, usually this is with a GP. [Check if you need to speak to one first](app://faqDetails/A5860D3E35B9483387D94B967676317B).
2. You’re referred to see a specialist or for tests if you need them.
3. We’ll either get your referral direct from a Bupa digital GP, or if you got a referral elsewhere, you can request treatment. 
4. We’ll check if you’re covered and give you a pre-authorisation number.
5. We'll send you a list of specialists or places to have tests or treatment. Choose one and contact them to make your appointment.
6. Once you’ve had a consultation, tests or treatment, we’ll set up your claim.
7. We’ll get sent an invoice from the specialist or place you visited. We'll pay them and let you know if there's anything you need to pay.

Title: What counts as a claim?
Description:
A claim is only made when you’ve had pre-authorised consultation, tests or treatment.

### Not counted as a claim: ###
- Bupa digital appointments
- Anytime HealthLine
- Family Mental HealthLine
- [Direct Access](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-insurance/speak-to-a-specialist) appointments

### Claim examples: ###
- Consultations with a specialist
- Scans, blood tests or X-rays
- Procedures such as injections or surgery
- Physio sessions
- Therapy sessions
- Cancer care
- Cash benefits, such as NHS or optical

Title: Where can I find my claim invoice?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Claims’. 

Here you’ll see how much Bupa has paid and how much you need to pay, if anything.

Title: Why have I been asked to pay?
Description:
There are three possible reasons:

### Excess ###
Many people have an excess. This is the amount you’ll be asked to contribute towards tests, consultations or treatment within a year. 

[How to check your excess](app://faqDetails/41A4D9A44CA74E3B8905A858C36FDBEB)

### Co-pay ### 
Some people who get cover through work have a co-pay. This is when you pay a percentage of your treatment cost, up to a total amount each year.
 
[How co-pay works](app://faqDetails/65B6A9B9134B4209A932039F135813BC)

### Benefit allowance ###
Some people have a benefit allowance. This means there’s a cap on how much Bupa will pay in a year for different types of treatment. Not every treatment has an allowance. 

### An example: ###

Consultations - paid in full. This means there’s no benefit allowance. 

Outpatient therapy, such as physio – up to £500. This means there is a benefit allowance. If it costs more, you’ll be asked to pay the rest.

[How to check your benefit allowance](app://faqDetails/EE348F7B211D498A93681A55F1BE1D56)

Title: Why is the app still showing I need to pay a claim after I’ve paid?
Description:
When we say ‘You pay’ in the claims area of the app, this is to show your contribution amount. It’s not a demand for payment. 

Because you pay the health facility or consultant directly, only they will follow up with you if payment hasn’t been made. 

If you’ve already paid, there’s nothing left for you to do.

Title: What’s my excess?
Description:
Your excess total is listed in your certificate. 

To find this document, go into My Bupa and scroll down on the home screen. 

You’ll see an option labelled ‘Documents’. From here, you can view or download your certificate. 

You may see ‘co-pay’ instead of excess if you get cover through work, which works in a similar way to excess.

### If you are on someone else’s cover: ###
To check your excess total, you’ll need to ask them to look on their account for you.

Title: What is co-pay?
Description:
Co-pay is when you pay a percentage of your treatment cost, up to a total amount each year. 

### For example: ###
10% co-pay. Max £100 in a year.

That means if you have a consultation that costs £200, you’ll pay 10%, which is £20. 

£100 max total - £20 co-pay = £80 left. 

When you next have to contribute to treatment costs, it will be no more than £80.

### Check if you have a co-pay ###
Go to your My Bupa home screen and scroll down. Next, choose ‘Documents’. 

From here, you can view or download your  certificate which will include details of a co-pay, if you have one.

If you’re on someone else’s cover, you’ll need to ask them to look on their account for you.

Title: How do I pay my excess or co-pay?
Description:
You’ll never pay Bupa directly. We’ll advise you on how to pay the consultant or facility. 

### How it works ###
1. We’ll set up a ‘claim’, which is our way of documenting any authorised tests or treatment you’ve had. 
2. You’ll get a notification to view your new claim in My Bupa. 
3. From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Claims’. Here you’ll see how much Bupa have paid and how much you need to pay, if any. 
4. Select your latest claim and scroll to the bottom. Attached will be a claims advice document detailing how to contact your consultant or the facility to pay your excess or co-pay.

Title: Do I need to pay for consultations?
Description:
Sometimes. It depends on your type of cover and if you have a benefit allowance, excess or co-pay.

### If you have a benefit allowance ###
This is how much you’re covered for in a year for different types of consultations or treatment.

### If you have any excess left ###
You’ll need to pay this towards your consultation cost. We’ll pay the rest up to your benefit allowance.

### If you have no excess ###
We’ll cover the full cost of your consultation up to your benefit allowance.

### If your cover renewal date is coming up ###
When renewing, your excess resets. This happens on the same date you got your cover. 

If your consultation takes place after renewal, you’ll be asked to pay your excess again. This may cover all or some of the costs of your consultation. If it only covers part, we’ll pay the rest up to your benefit allowance.

### If you have a co-pay ###
This is when you pay a percentage of your treatment cost, up to a total amount each year. We’ll pay the rest up to your benefit allowance.

### Important information ###
Checking your documents can help you understand your cover more. 

For example, if your cover includes a set number of consultations within six months, we’ll tell you. 

To find your documents, go to your My Bupa home screen and scroll down. Next, choose ‘Documents’.

Title: How do I claim my cash benefits?
Description:
What we need from you depends on the type of cash benefit. 

Choose which cash benefit you’d like help with for next steps.

Title: How to claim your accidental dental cash benefit
Description:
To help you, we’ll need a photo or copy of any invoices or receipts for your treatment. Please include your name and membership number.

Your treatment must have been for an injury caused by external impact, such as falling or a non-contact sport. We also ask that treatment started within six months of your injury and is completed within six years. 

### Where to send your info ###
Please email your invoices or receipts to bupamemberservices@bupa.com or post them to Bupa Claims, Bupa Place, 102 The Quays, Salford M50 3SP.

### Next steps ###
Once we have them, we’ll check your cover and reach out by text to let you know the outcome.

Title: How to claim your cancer cash benefit
Description:
Our dedicated oncology team can help you. Please call them on [0345 850 0465](phone://03458500465) when you’re ready.

Lines are open 8am to 8pm, Monday to Friday, 8am to 4pm on Saturdays. We may record or monitor our phone calls.

Title: How to claim your family cash benefit
Description:
To help you, we’ll need a photo or copy of your child’s birth or adoption certificate. Please include your name and membership number too.

### Where to send your info ###
Please email your invoices or receipts to bupamemberservices@bupa.com or post them to Bupa Claims, Bupa Place, 102 The Quays, Salford M50 3SP.

### Next steps ###
Once we have it, we’ll check your cover and reach out by text to let you know the outcome.

Title: How to claim your NHS cash benefit
Description:
To help you, we’ll need your name and membership number. You can find this in My Bupa in the ‘Account’ section. 

We’ll also need a photo or copy of your hospital discharge letter. Please check it includes the date you were admitted and discharged, your health condition, any treatment and the consultant’s name.

### Where to send your info ###
Please email it to bupamemberservices@bupa.com or post it to Bupa Claims, Bupa Place, 102 The Quays, Salford M50 3SP.

### Next steps ###
Once we have it, we’ll check that it’s for an eligible condition and included with your cover. We’ll reach out by text to let you know the outcome.

Title: How to claim your optical cash benefit
Description:
To help you, we’ll need a photo or copy of your receipt on headed paper from the eye specialist you visited. The paper should also include the specialist’s full name, membership number and address.

### Where to send your info ###
Please email your invoices or receipts to bupamemberservices@bupa.com or post them to Bupa Claims, Bupa Place, 102 The Quays, Salford M50 3SP.

### Next steps ###
Once we have them, we’ll check your cover and reach out by text to let you know the outcome.

Title: How to claim your prescription cash benefit
Description:
To help you, we’ll need a photo of your invoice of receipt. This needs to show the cost and where you got the prescription from.

### Where to send your info ###
Please email this to us at 
bupamemberservices@bupa.com or post it to Bupa Claims, Bupa Place, 102 The Quays, Salford M50 3SP.

### Next steps ###
Once we have it, we’ll check your cover and reach out by text to let you know the outcome.

Title: What does the optical cash benefit cover?
Description:
### You can claim money back for: ###
- Routine eye tests
- Prescription glasses
- Prescription contact lenses
- Corrective laser treatment

### Not sure you have this benefit? ###
Check your guide first. To find this, go to My Bupa home screen and scroll to ‘Documents’. You can view and download it to check your benefit table.

Title: What does the dental cash benefit cover?
Description:
### You can claim money back for: ###
- General dental treatment, such as check-ups, cleans, X-rays, fillings, crowns and gum disease treatment
- Emergency treatment due to severe pain or not being able to eat
- Treatment for a dental injury that meant you had so stay overnight in a UK hospital

### Not sure you have this benefit? ###
Check your guide first. To find this, go to My Bupa home screen and scroll to ‘Documents’. You can view and download it to check your benefit table.

Title: What do I need to make a dental claim?
Description:
If you visit a Bupa dental practice, they offer ‘instant claim’. This means they’ll sort your claim for you on the day. 

To submit a claim from a different dental practice, choose the type of treatment you’ve had for next steps:
Footer:
### Had more than one treatment? ###
You’ll need to claim for each one individually. 

### Paid a deposit? ###
Sometimes, your dentist may ask for a deposit before you have treatment. You can only claim this back after treatment. To do so, choose the relevant treatment type.

Title: Making a claim for preventative treatment
Description:
### You can claim for: ###
- New patient examination
- Routine examination
- Scale and polish
- X-ray

### You’ll need a receipt that has: ###
- Your name
- The type of treatment you’ve had
- Your treatment date
- The cost of each treatment
- Proof that you’ve paid
- Dental practice name and postcode  

If the information you send is incomplete or unreadable, it may delay your claim, or we may not be able to pay it.

### How to claim ###
From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Account’ in the menu at the bottom. Next, choose ‘Dental cover’ and then ‘Make a dental claim’.

Title: Making a claim for restorative treatment
Description:
### You can claim for: ###
- Fillings, including fissure sealant and topical flouride
- Root canal treatment
- Inlay or onlay
- Crowns, bridges or dentures
- Veneers
- Extractions
- Implants
- Mouthguards 
- Periodontal treatment for gum disease
- Oral surgery

### For fillings, you’ll need: ###
- A copy of your invoice or receipt

### For other restorative treatment, you’ll need a receipt that has: ###
- Your name
- The type of treatment you’ve had
- Your treatment date
- The cost of each treatment
- Proof that you’ve paid
- Dental practice name, address and postcode 

If the information you send is incomplete or unreadable, it may delay your claim, or we may not be able to pay it.

### We may also ask you for: ###
- X-rays or photos of your teeth, before and after treatment 
- Tooth number, known as the ‘tooth notion’, which your dentist can tell you
- Your dentist’s full clinical notes
- When your tooth was removed if you had an implant, bridge or dentures

### How to claim ###
From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Account’ in the menu at the bottom. Next, choose ‘Dental cover’ and then ‘Make a dental claim’.

Title: Making a claim for emergency treatment
Description:
### You can claim for: ###
- Severe pain
- Problems stopping you eating
- Conditions needing immediate treatment
- Prescription charges
- Dentist emergency call out fees

If treatment was pre-planned, we don’t count this as an emergency. You can still claim, but as the type of treatment you had, such as ‘restorative’ for removing a tooth. 

### You’ll need a receipt that has: ###
- Your name
- The type of treatment you’ve had
- Your treatment date
- The cost of each treatment
- Proof that you’ve paid
- Dental practice name, address and postcode 

If the information you send is incomplete or unreadable, it may delay your claim, or we may not be able to pay it. 

### How to claim ###
From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Account’ in the menu at the bottom. Next, choose ‘Dental cover’ and then ‘Make a dental claim’.

Title: Making a claim for dental injury treatment
Description:
To claim, treatment must have started within six months of your injury date, and be completed within two years. 

### You can claim for: ###
- Chipped, broken or cracked teeth
- Injuries from playing a contact support, such as rugby, as long as you were wearing a mouthguard supplied and fitted by a dental professional

We don’t cover injuries caused by piercings or eating.

### You’ll need a receipt that has: ###
- Your name
- The type of treatment you’ve had
- Your treatment date
- The cost of each treatment
- Proof that you’ve paid
- Dental practice name and postcode 

If the information you send is incomplete or unreadable, it may delay your claim, or we may not be able to pay it.

### We’ll also ask for: ###
- Details of what happened and when
- A letter or email from your dentist to say they fitted your mouthguard, if it’s a contact sport injury
- X-rays and photos of your teeth, before and after treatment
- Notes from your dentist that explain the treatment they carried out on your teeth

### How to claim ###
From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Account’ in the menu at the bottom. Next, choose ‘Dental cover’ and then ‘Make a dental claim’.

Title: Making a claim for orthodontic treatment
Description:
### You can claim for: ###
- Teeth straightening
- Bite issues
- Jaw alignment
- Space maintainers for children up to 18 years old
- Dental retainer

Straightening, bite or jaw problems need to be at certain level on the Index of Orthodontic Treatment Need (IOTN). This looks at how severe your dental needs are. You can check the level with your dentist.

- **For anyone 18 or younger** – treatment needs to be level three or above.
- **For anyone over 19** – treatment needs to be level four or above.

### You’ll need a receipt that has: ###
- Your name
- The type of treatment you’ve had
- Your treatment date
- The cost of each treatment
- Proof that you’ve paid
- Dental practice name and postcode 

If the information you send is incomplete or unreadable, it may delay your claim, or we may not be able to pay it.

### You’ll need to share a treatment plan including: ###
- The total cost
- How long your treatment will take
- The IOTN level – this will be a number from one to five. We don’t need this for space retainers for anyone 18 or under. 

### How to claim ###
From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Account’ in the menu at the bottom. Next, choose ‘Dental cover’ and then ‘Make a dental claim’.

Title: Making a claim for overseas treatment
Description:
### You can claim for: ###
- Preventative treatment
- Restorative treatment
- Emergencies
- Injuries

### You’ll need a receipt that has: ### 
- Your name
- The type of treatment you’ve had
- Your treatment date
- The cost of each treatment
- Proof that you’ve paid
- Dental practice name and postcode 

If the information you send is incomplete or unreadable, it may delay your claim, or we may not be able to pay it.

### We’ll also ask you for: ###
- X-rays or photos of your teeth, before and after treatment 
- Tooth number, known as the ‘tooth notion’, which your dentist can tell you
- Your dentist’s full clinical notes
- When your tooth was extracted if you had an implant, bridge or dentures 

### How to claim ###
From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Account’ in the menu at the bottom. Next, choose ‘Dental cover’ and then ‘Make a dental claim’.

Title: Can I claim at the dental practice?
Description:
If the Bupa dental practice offers ‘instant claim’, yes. 

Instant claim means you have your treatment and the receptionist will process the claim on your behalf. 

If you’re fully covered for your treatment, you’ll pay nothing. 

You'll need to pay for any treatment that isn't covered on your policy. For example, if you’ve used all of a benefit allowance.

Title: How quickly is a dental claim paid?
Description:
9 out of 10 claims are usually processed within 24 hours. 

We'll text you with an update on your claim. If it's approved, we'll send the money to your bank account.

Sometimes, claims can take longer if we don’t have all the information we need. If this happens, we’ll email you to ask for extra details.

Title: Can I claim for NHS treatment?
Description:
Yes, we'll pay up to the maximum amount your cover allows for each type of treatment. We call these benefit allowances.

### Steps to claim NHS treatment ###
1. From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Account’ in the menu at the bottom. 
2. Choose ‘Dental cover’ and then ‘Make a claim’.
3. Add each treatment you’ve had individually. If you have the total cost instead of a breakdown of charges, you can work out the cost of each treatment by checking the [NHS bandings](https://www.nhs.uk/nhs-services/dentists/how-much-nhs-dental-treatment-costs/). These may be different depending on where you live. 

### An example ###
Your NHS dentist gives you a filling. Under NHS prices, this would be a ‘Band 2’ treatment, costing £75.30 in England.

To claim, you’d split your treatment this way: 

- £27.40 for ‘preventative treatment’ which is for your dental examination.
- £47.90 for the filling. 

£27.40 + £47.90 = £75.30 paid back to you.

Title: What are my dental benefit allowances?
Description:
You can find details of each benefit allowance in the ‘Table of Cover’ inside your policy guide. Everyone covered on your policy can claim up to these amounts.

To find your policy guide, go to your My Bupa home screen and scroll down. Next, choose ‘Documents’. 

From here, you can view or download your policy guide.

Title: Where can I find my dental insurance documents?
Description:
Go to your My Bupa home screen and scroll down. Next, choose ‘Documents’. 

From here, you can view or download your dental insurance guide.

Title: Why can’t I see my cover documents?
Description:
Sometimes your documents aren’t ready yet, or we’ve not been able to match your details on our system.

### If you pay for your policy ###
It can take up to 24 hours for your cover documents to show in My Bupa. We’ll email you when they are ready. 

If it’s been longer, please [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).

### If your work pay for your policy ###
- First year of cover – we aim to show your documents within 24 hours of your employer confirming your cover. If you are part of a large business, this can be longer. We'll email you at work to let you know when they're ready.

- Renewing years – it can take longer for your renewal documents to appear while your company agrees the details of your cover for the next year. Once agreed, we aim to share documents within 5 to 20 working days.

Title: How do I book a dental appointment?
Description:
Use our [online search](https://www.bupa.co.uk/dental/dental-care) to find a dentist close to you. 

We’ll show you a list of results based on your postcode. 

Choose the one you’d like to visit and select ‘Book an appointment’.

Title: Can I get an evening or weekend appointment?
Description:
Many of our dental practices offer extended opening times. 

To check if your local Bupa dental practice has this availability, [search by postcode](https://www.bupa.co.uk/dental/dental-care).

We’ll list your closest practices with their opening times.

Title: How do I book a health assessment?
Description:
The easiest way to book is [online](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-assessments). You can also call us on [0345 600 3458](phone://03456003458). 

Lines open Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 4pm. We may record or monitor our phone calls.

Title: Where can I find the health questionnaire?
Description:
You can get to your questionnaire from the My Bupa home screen. There will be an option labelled ‘Health questionnaires.’

We’ll also send you an email that will take you to the right area.

Title: What does the health questionnaire include?
Description:
We’ll ask about:

- Personal details, such as gender and your sex at birth, to help tailor tests and advice
- Health history, such as conditions or medication
- Family history
- Lifestyle, such as physical activity, alcohol and sleep
- Mental health, such as how you’ve been feeling lately

We ask these questions to understand more about you and to discuss your goals.

Title: What happens if I don’t complete the health questionnaire?
Description:
If you don’t complete your health questionnaire before your assessment, it could impact your experience on the day. 

We may still ask you to fill a paper copy out at the health centre which can take you more time. Sometimes this can mean missing some of your appointment time. 

### What are the benefits of doing it in advance? ###
- Our health specialists have time to tailor their advice around your health history, family and your lifestyle so that it’s more relevant. 
- Saves you time on the day.

Title: What will my health assessment include?
Description:
To check what’s included, [view our assessments](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/health-assessments/compare-health-assessments).

### Not sure which one to look at? ###
- If you bought the assessment yourself, check your confirmation email. 
- If you get your assessment through work, you’ll hear from us by email or from your employer about which assessment you can have.

Title: When will I get my health assessment report?
Description:
Usually, it’s within 24 hours of your appointment. 

If we’ve emailed you but your report isn’t showing, it means our clinician just needs a little longer to finish your report. 

If you’ve not had your report within three working days, please [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).

Title: Where can I find my health assessment reports?
Description:
You can get to your report from the My Bupa home screen. There will be an option labelled ‘Health assessment reports.’

You’ll be able to view your most recent report and any you’ve had in the past, if you used the same log in details.

Title: What’s included with Well+ Bronze?
Description:
### Digital GP time ###
- 10-minute GP appointments within the app.
- Private prescriptions, you just pay the medication cost.
- Fit notes.

### Muscle, bone and joint help ###
- 20-minute calls with a muscle, bone and joint specialist for advice on treatment.
- Self-led physio programmes within the Physitrack app.

### Mental health support ###
- 20-minute calls with a mental health specialist for advice on treatment.
- 10 self-managed, online mental wellbeing programmes through SilverCloud.

### Wellbeing support ###
- Online fitness classes and relaxing meditations.

### Important information ###
Services are subject to availability and are only available to use in the UK. Scans and tests are not included.

Title: Where are my product documents?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Documents’. 

This is where you can view or download your subscription document.

Title: How do I book a GP appointment?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. Next, ‘Book a digital appointment’. 

Depending on your health concern, we’ll recommend a GP, nurse, physio or mental health specialist to talk through what you’re experiencing.

Title: How can I get help for muscle, bone or joint pain?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. Next, ‘Book a digital appointment’. 

During the call, we’ll ask about your symptoms so we can recommend treatment.

Title: How can I get help for my mental health?
Description:
You can call our mental health helpline. From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. You’ll be able to talk to our team from here, day or night.

We’ll recommend either:

- A self-help online mental wellbeing programme through SilverCloud
- Pay as you go treatment, such as therapy, which we’ll explain how to access

Title: What’s an online mental wellbeing programme?
Description:
A self-led programme provided by SilverCloud, designed to help with common problems. For example:

### Stress ###
How to manage it, use problem solving to your advantage and communicate effectively.

### Sleep ###
Practical tips on catching more ZZZs with a new and improved sleep routine. 

### Resilience ###
Looking at self-esteem, connections to others and ways to boost healthy habits. 

### Money worries ###
How to shake unhelpful thinking patterns, reduce comfort spending and more.

### Alcohol ###
Understanding your relationship with drink, the effects and how to handle triggers. 

### Body image ###
How we view ourselves, when this can become a problem and challenging negative thoughts.

Title: How do I access SilverCloud?
Description:
Once you’ve spoken to our mental health team, we’ll email you a link. 

The email will tell you which online mental wellbeing programme is recommended and how to get started.

### Not spoken to the mental health team? ###
You’ll need to call our mental health helpline before starting a programme.

From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. You’ll be able to talk to our team from here, day or night.

Title: How do I change or cancel my appointment?
Description:
If you’d like a different appointment time, please cancel and rebook.

To cancel, go to ‘Treatment and care’ on your My Bupa home screen. Next, choose ‘Manage appointments’.

Title: What happens if I miss my appointment?
Description:
If you miss the call, we’ll try to contact you again. 

If you don't answer, we won’t be able to carry out the appointment and you’ll need to book a new one.

Title: How does a private prescription work?
Description:
After you’ve had a Bupa digital GP appointment, we’ll email you with a prescription ID the same or next working day.

We work with a company called SignatureRX who will use this ID to let pharmacies know what medication you need.

The email will give you two choices, collection or delivery.

### If you choose collection ###
Your email includes a pharmacy locator. Not every pharmacy accepts SignatureRX prescriptions, so please check the list first.

### If you choose delivery ###
You’ll get a second email with a payment link, usually within two hours.

Once paid, your medication will usually be delivered within 48 hours. If you live in London, you can get same day delivery if your request is before 4pm, Monday to Friday, or before 12pm on weekends.

Title: Do I need to pay for a private prescription?
Description:
You will need to pay for the medication listed on your prescription.

Medication costs vary by medicine and by the pharmacy who dispenses it, it’s not a flat fee like in the NHS

### If you want to collect your prescription ###
The pharmacy will tell you the cost.

### If you want your prescription delivered ###
The cost of your medication and delivery will be shown before you pay.

Title: Where can I find my prescription?
Description:
We’ll send you an email when it’s ready. This can take up to one working day.

### Not arrived within one working day? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll get started.

Title: Where can I find my fit note?
Description:
We’ll send you an email when it’s ready. This can take up to one working day.

Your email will include a link to a portal where you’ll be asked to verify your phone number. To do this, you’ll be sent a code by SMS to your phone.

Once you’re verified, you’ll be able to download your fit note.

### Not arrived within one working day? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll get started.

Title: What’s included with Well+ Silver?
Description:
### Digital GP time ###
- 10-minute GP appointments within the app.
- Private prescription writing, you just pay the medication cost.
- Fit notes.

### Muscle, bone and joint help ###
- 20-minute remote muscle, bone and joint assessments to work out treatment steps.
- Six remote physio sessions.
- Self-led physio programmes with the Physitrack app.

### Mental health support ###
- 20-minute calls with a mental health specialist to work out treatment steps.
- Six remote counselling sessions with a therapist.
- Eight remote cognitive behavioural therapy sessions, known as CBT. 
- Two hours of remote personal coaching.
- 10 self-managed, online mental wellbeing programmes through SilverCloud.
- For more complex mental health issues, we offer two hours of remote support from our concierge service each year. You’ll be given a personal case manager who’ll point you towards the right help. If the help you need is not included with your subscription, they’ll explain how to get this with the NHS or how to access pay as you go services.

### Wellbeing support ###
- Online fitness classes and relaxing meditations.

### Important information ###
Services are subject to availability and are only available to use in the UK. Scans and tests are not included.

Title: Where are my product documents?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Documents’. 

This is where you can view or download your subscription document.

Title: How do I book a GP appointment?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. Next, ‘Book a digital appointment’. 

Depending on your health concern, we’ll recommend a GP, nurse, physio or mental health specialist to talk through what you’re experiencing.

Title: How can I get help for muscle, bone or joint pain?
Description:
From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. Next, ‘Book a digital appointment’. 

We’ll ask about your symptoms and offer you an appointment with a physiotherapist by video or phone. 

During the call, they’ll recommend treatment that suits your symptoms.

Title: How do I book a therapy session?
Description:
The first step is to speak to our mental health team about what you’re experiencing.

They’ll recommend treatment, which may or may not include therapy. It could be:

- Remote counselling
- Remote cognitive behavioural therapy sessions, known as CBT
- Personal coaching
- A self-help online mental wellbeing programme through SilverCloud
- Other mental health support, which may mean help through the NHS or by using a pay as you go service

### How to speak to the team ###
From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. You’ll be able to contact the team from here, day or night.

Title: How do I book personal coaching?
Description:
Before you can book, we need to check if coaching is recommended based on what you’re experiencing. 

To start, choose ‘Treatment and care’ on your My Bupa home screen. Under ‘Manage my care’, there’s an option for personal coaching. We’ll ask you a few questions before showing you next steps. 

### If coaching is recommended: ###
You’ll be able to pick a coach, with a choice of gender, along with an appointment time. 

When it’s time for your coaching, come back to the app to start your appointment.

### If we recommend something else: ###
This means you won’t be able to book personal coaching. Instead, we’ll ask you to speak to our mental health team. They’ll advise you on treatment available that better matches your needs.

Title: What’s an online mental wellbeing programme?
Description:
A self-led programme provided by SilverCloud, designed to help with common problems. For example:

### Stress ###
How to manage it, use problem solving to your advantage and communicate effectively.

### Sleep ###
Practical tips on catching more ZZZs with a new and improved sleep routine. 

### Resilience ###
Looking at self-esteem, connections to others and ways to boost healthy habits. 

### Money worries ###
How to shake unhelpful thinking patterns, reduce comfort spending and more.

### Alcohol ###
Understanding your relationship with drink, the effects and how to handle triggers. 

### Body image ###
How we view ourselves, when this can become a problem and challenging negative thoughts.

Title: How do I access SilverCloud?
Description:
Once you’ve spoken to our mental health team, we’ll email you a link. 

The email will tell you which online mental wellbeing programme is recommended and how to get started.

### Not spoken to the mental health team? ###
You’ll need to call our mental health helpline before starting a programme.

From your My Bupa home screen, choose ‘Treatment and care’. You’ll be able to talk to our team from here, day or night.

Title: How do I change or cancel my appointment?
Description:
If you’d like a different appointment time, please cancel and rebook.

To cancel, go to ‘Treatment and care’ on your My Bupa home screen. Next, choose ‘Manage appointments’.

Title: What happens if I miss my appointment?
Description:
If you miss the call, we’ll try to contact you again. 

If you don't answer, we won’t be able to carry out the appointment and you’ll need to book a new one.

Title: What if I need tests or to be seen face to face?
Description:
If we recommend being seen in person or to go for tests, for example blood tests, you have two options:

- Continue getting help with your NHS GP
- Use one of our [pay to see a Bupa physio privately](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/payg/physiotherapy)

Title: What happens if my physio sessions run out?
Description:
You get six physio sessions a year, if you need more treatment after this you have two options:

- Pay to see a [private Bupa physio](https://www.bupa.co.uk/health/payg/physiotherapy)
- During your last session with us, your physio can help you access further treatment through the NHS.

Title: What happens if my mental health sessions run out?
Description:
You get six counselling and eight behaviour therapy appointments by phone each year. If you need more after this, you have two options:

- Pay for more private treatment
- Continue care with the NHS 

To chat through these options, go to ‘Treatment and care’ on your home screen. Next, choose ‘Mental health helpline’. 

Our mental health concierge, which is someone trained to help you plan next steps, will talk you through how to arrange either option. You get up to two hours of concierge help each year.

Title: How does a private prescription work?
Description:
After you’ve had a Bupa digital GP appointment, we’ll email you with a prescription ID the same or next working day.

We work with a company called SignatureRX who will use this ID to let pharmacies know what medication you need.

The email will give you two choices, collection or delivery.

### If you choose collection ###
Your email includes a pharmacy locator. Not every pharmacy accepts SignatureRX prescriptions, so please check the list first.

### If you choose delivery ###
You’ll get a second email with a payment link, usually within two hours.

Once paid, your medication will usually be delivered within 48 hours. If you live in London, you can get same day delivery if your request is before 4pm, Monday to Friday, or before 12pm on weekends.

Title: Do I need to pay for a private prescription?
Description:
You will need to pay for the medication listed on your prescription.

Medication costs vary by medicine and by the pharmacy who dispenses it, it’s not a flat fee like in the NHS

### If you want to collect your prescription ###
The pharmacy will tell you the cost.

### If you want your prescription delivered ###
The cost of your medication and delivery will be shown before you pay.

Title: Where can I find my prescription?
Description:
We’ll send you an email when it’s ready. This can take up to one working day.

### Not arrived within one working day? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll get started.

Title: Where can I find my fit note?
Description:
You’ll be sent an email when it’s ready. This can take up to one working day.
We’ll send you an email when it’s ready. This can take up to one working day.

Your email will include a link to a portal where you’ll be asked to verify your phone number. To do this, you’ll be sent a code by SMS to your phone.

Once you’re verified, you’ll be able to download your fit note.

### Not arrived within one working day? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. [Contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet) and we’ll get started.
Your email will include a link to a portal where you’ll be asked to verify your phone number. To do this, you’ll be sent a code by SMS to your phone.

Once you’re verified, you’ll be able to download your fit note.

### Not arrived within one working day? ###
1. Check your junk email, just in case.
2. If you get cover through work, check if it’s been sent to your work email. If it has and you’d prefer to use your personal email in future, contact us.
3. We’ll need to investigate for you. Contact us and we’ll get started.

Title: How do I update my address?
Description:
### If it’s your cover ###
You can do this by starting a [Bupa chat](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet). We’ll ask you which cover you’d like to update. If you have more than one, you can change one at a time. 

### If you’re on a partner or parent’s cover ###
They’ll need to update the address for you.

Title: How do I update my phone number?
Description:
### For you ###
Go to ‘Account’ the bottom menu on your home screen. Next choose the cog icon to go to settings. From here you’ll be able to update your personal details such as your phone number. 

### For someone else who is 16 or over ###
Because of their age, only they can edit this information. To do this, they’ll need to log into My Bupa with their own account.

Title: How do I update my date of birth?
Description:
### For you ###
You can do this by starting a [Bupa chat](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet). We’ll ask you which policy you’d like to update. If you have more than one, you can change one at a time. 

### For someone else under 16 ###
If they are on your policy, you can change their number by starting a [Bupa chat](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).  

### For someone else who is 16 or over ###
Because of their age, only they can edit this information. To do this, they’ll need to log into My Bupa with their own account.

Title: How do I update my contact preferences?
Description:
[Update your preferences](https://www.bupa.co.uk/consent/preferences-not-available) for email, phone, text and post.

### What might we send you? ###
- Healthcare advice
- Info on new services or product updates
- Offers on pay-as-you-go services

Title: How can I check my benefit allowance?
Description:
Go to your My Bupa home screen and scroll down. Next, choose ‘Documents’. 

From here, you can view or download your guide which includes a benefit table.

Title: Why can’t I see my cover documents?
Description:
Sometimes your documents aren’t ready yet, or we’ve not been able to match your details on the system.

### If you pay for your cover ###
It can take up to 24 hours for your cover documents to show in My Bupa. We’ll email you when they are ready. 

If it’s been longer, please [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).

### If your work pay for your cover ###
- First year of cover – we aim to show your documents within 24 hours of your employer confirming your cover. If you are part of a large business, this can be longer. We’ll email your work email when they are ready.


- Renewing years – it can take longer for your new documents to appear whilst your company agrees the details of your cover for the next year. Once agreed, we aim to share documents within 5 to 20 working days. If you’re part of a small business, this is usually less than 10 working days.

Title: No sound during my appointment
Description:
You may need to update your app permissions. 

When you first got the app, we asked for video and audio permission. If you said no, you won’t be able to hear during your appointment. 

### If you have an iPhone ###
Go to settings, then ‘Privacy & Security’. You’ll see an option for microphone. 

### If you have an android ###
Go to settings, then ‘Apps’. Choose My Bupa and edit your audio preference.

Title: Video isn’t working during my appointment
Description:
You may need to update your app permissions. 

When you first got the app, we asked for video and audio permission. If you said no, the video feature won’t work during your appointment.  

### If you have an iPhone ###
Go to settings, then ‘Privacy & Security’. You’ll see an option for camera. 

### If you have an android ###
Go to settings, then ‘Apps’. Choose My Bupa and edit your camera preference.

Title: Can’t verify my ID
Description:
There are a few reasons why we aren’t able to verify an ID. 

### ID expired ###
This means we’d need an alternative ID.

### Image quality ###
Try laying it flat on a surface to take the photo.

### Missing information ### 
We can’t see the ID in full. Try taking the photo further away.

### Age ###
We can’t verify children under 16 as they need to attend the appointment with an adult. Instead, please upload the main member or beneficiary’s ID. This is the parent who owns the cover.

Title: Test results
Description:
Tests results won’t appear in My Bupa unless you’ve had a health assessment. These are found in your ‘Health report’.

All other test results will be sent to you by email or post by the health facility or consultant you visited. Sometimes they may call you instead. 

If you’d like an update before they contact you, please call them directly.

Title: Health assesment report
Description:
Usually, your health assessment report is ready within 24 hours of your appointment. 

If we’ve emailed you but your report isn’t showing, it means our clinician just needs a little longer to finish your report. 

If you’ve not had yours within three working days, please [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet).

Title: Pre-authorisation code
Description:
Each code is sent by email, SMS and added to My Bupa. 

From your My Bupa home screen, go to ‘Pre-authorisations’.

Next, choose ‘View pre-authorisations’, then scroll to select the one you need. 

### If you’ve already checked those locations ###
- Your code might not be ready yet, it can take up to 24 hours 
- Your code will disappear once it’s been used. If you want more treatment, you’ll need another code.

Title: I want to see my partner’s claims
Description:
Even if you are both on the same cover, you won’t be able to view your partner’s appointments or claims. 

This is to protect their personal data in line with General Data Protection Regulation, known as GDPR.

Title: I want to see my child’s cover details
Description:
Only the main member or beneficiary will be able to see details about your child’s cover.

The main member or beneficiary is the person who took out the cover. 

This is to protect your child’s personal data in line with General Data Protection Regulation, known as GDPR.

Title: I can’t book an appointment for my child
Description:
For children under 16, only the main member or beneficiary on your cover can book for them. 

Children aged 16 or over will need to create their own account to book.

Title: How do I make a new complaint?
Description:
We’re sorry that you’re unhappy with your experience. 

Please fill in an [online complaint form](https://account.bupa.co.uk/?service=ocoilogin&dest_app=touchdashboard&goto=https%3A%2F%2Fidentity.bupa.co.uk%3A443%2Fam%2Foauth2%2Fauthorize%3Fclient_id%3Doauth2touchdashboardclient%26redirect_uri%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.bupa.co.uk%2Fmybupa%2Fdashboard%26locale%3Dtouchdashboard%26response_type%3Dcode%26oiversion%3D2.0%26state%3Dabc-123&realm=/alpha&locale=touchdashboard).

Title: How can I add more details to an existing complaint?
Description: If you have more information to add or any questions, please complete an [online form](https://account.bupa.co.uk/?service=ocoilogin&dest_app=touchdashboard&goto=https%3A%2F%2Fidentity.bupa.co.uk%3A443%2Fam%2Foauth2%2Fauthorize%3Fclient_id%3Doauth2touchdashboardclient%26redirect_uri%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.bupa.co.uk%2Fmybupa%2Fdashboard%26locale%3Dtouchdashboard%26response_type%3Dcode%26oiversion%3D2.0%26state%3Dabc-123&realm=/alpha&locale=touchdashboard).

Title: When will Bupa look at my complaint?
Description:
Once we get your complaint, we’ll email you within two working days to confirm we’re looking into it. 

We usually resolve problems within five and  a half working days. Sometimes it can take longer depending on the complexity of your complaint.

For more details, please choose the service you’ve made a complaint about:

Title: Health or dental insurance complaints
Description:
If we’ve not resolved your complaint within five days, we’ll write to you explaining next steps. 

Once we’ve reached an outcome, we’ll email or write to you to explain our decision. 

### Within four weeks ###
We’ll contact you with updates as soon as we have them. 

If we haven’t resolved it by the 20th working day, we’ll send you a letter known as a holding letter. This explains why your complaint is taking longer. 

### After eight weeks ###
If we haven’t resolved it in this time, we’ll send you another holding letter.

At this stage, you can also contact the Financial Ombudsman Service to complain.

Title: Well+ subscription complaints
Description:
If we’ve not resolved your complaint within five days, we’ll write to you explaining next steps. 

We’ll contact you with updates as soon as we have them. 

Once we’ve fully investigated your complaint, we’ll email or write to you to explain our decision. 

This can take up to eight weeks, but in most cases it’s quicker.

Title: Health assessment complaints
Description:
If we’ve not resolved your complaint within five days, we’ll write to you explaining next steps.
 
We will send you a full written response following our investigation within 20 working days.

If you’re not happy with the outcome, [contact us](app://getHelpFaqBottomsheet). We’ll ask a  senior manager to review it for you.

Sometimes, a panel may also discuss your complaint to resolve it.

After this, if you feel your concerns still haven’t been resolved, you can contact the Independent Sector Complaints Adjudication Service known as ICAS.

They’ll review your complaint and explain their findings to you.

Title: How to Make a claim in the My Bupa app
Description:
If you have Bupa dental insurance, you can claim for dental treatment using My Bupa.
You can also use My Bupa to:

check what treatments you’re covered for
see your treatment history
manage your cover
You can download the My Bupa app or sign in online.
